Action.author: caod
Action.body: https://logs.hyperledger.org/production/vex-yul-hyp-jenkins-3/fabric-verify-integration-tests-x86_64/12271/console-timestamp.log.gz logs from a test that hit the retry threshold and failed because the elapsed time ended up longer than the Eventually timeout

Action.author: caod
Action.body: This is not necessarily a bug/flake since the failure linked above is specific to how the pvtdataProvider was handling the retry logic (introducing a small delta that ended up going beyond the threshold). It has since been readjusted to drop the delta.

Action.author: caod
Action.body: /cc ~denyeart ~btl5037 this may be related to the CI flakes

Action.author: caod
Action.body: Adding to this, we should figure out why when we decreased the pull retry threshold in https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/pull/367 why were the tests that needed pvtdata flaking anyways on pull retry. (See Jason's comment on linked PR)

Action.author: denyeart
Action.body: Recent private data test improvements may have fixed this. Will close for now, please re-open if the issue is seen again.
